Description Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
1

(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/24/25, a youth was taken to the hospital for alleged suicidal
ideations. It was determined that the youth was not suicidal but
does not want to reside at the facility. On an unknown date, a staff
member touched the youth's buttocks.
Investigation Interviews
Messages were left for Complainant on 06/09/2025 and
06/11/2025 without a return a call. Phone contact was established
with Complainant on 06/30/2025. Complainant stated Youth A did
not identify the staff that touched his buttocks and did not provide
details of the incident. Complainant did not have additional
information.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/31/2025 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service (DHHS)
Worker. Youth A stated things are going “good” at Wolverine
Center, but expressed his interest in returning home with family.
Youth A denied boundary issues with staff, but stated a youth
threatened to kiss him and grab his “cheeks” (buttocks). Youth A
stated he said, “Please don’t do that, I won’t like that” to this youth
and nothing occurred between them. Youth A stated this verbal
threat occurred one time. Youth A stated he did not know the
name of this youth and did not want to describe the youth’s
appearance. Youth A stated he met with his foster care worker on
05/30/2025 and shared his desire to be placed with his family.
Youth B was interviewed on 05/31/2025 at Wolverine Center with
another DHHS Worker. Youth B stated he is more comfortable
with the staff than the youths at Wolverine Center. Youth B stated
he does not have boundary (inappropriate or sexual interactions)
concerns with staff or youth at Wolverine Center.
Youth C was interviewed on 05/31/2025 at Wolverine Center with
another DHHS Worker. Youth C stated he did not want to be
randomly selected for an interview and left the interview room.
Youth C was not pursued further for an interview.
Youth D was interviewed on 06/05/2025 at Wolverine Center.
Youth D stated he does not have boundary concerns with youth or
with staff. Youth D stated he is unaware of a Wolverine Center
2

youth having boundary issues with another youth or a staff. Youth
D stated he would report boundary concerns to a supervisor.
Documentation
Youth A does not have any documentation supporting a boundary
issue with a Wolverine Center staff or youth.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance because Youth A stated a
boundary issue with staff did not occur. Youth A stated an
unidentified youth verbally threatened a boundary issue, but did
not act on it.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
